text: Rúben Diogo da Silva Neves (, born 13 March 1997) is Portuguese professional footballers, He currently plays Al Hilal for the Saudi Professional League and Portugal national football team. ==Club Career== ===Porto=== Neves grew up supporting and joined Porto is club youth system at the 8 Years old He played a first club in his senior career In 2014-15 season, he played his first matches in UEFA Champions League. He became a youngest footballer captain in the world. At age of 17, he made his Primeira Liga debut where he started and scored in a 2–0 home matches beat a Marítimo. ===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== On 8 July 2017, Neves signed for EFL Championship club Wolverhampton Wanderers for an fee, believed to be in the region of £15.8 million – a club and league record fee. In October 16, 2022, Neves scored a penalty kick and results 1-0 and Wolverhampton Wanderers beat Nottingham Forest. ===Al Hilal=== On 23 June 2023 Neves joined Al Hilal for 47 million euro transfer fee. ==International Career== Neves played a 2022 FIFA World Cup Qatar but defeat by Morocco in quarter final, portugal was eliminated in semi-final In 2019 UFEA Nations League Finals on home soil, he played semi finals match and beat Switzerland 3-1 but was taken out of the starting lineup for the final against the Netherlands and replaced with more defensive Danilo. Neves played Portugal at the 2014 UEFA European Under-17 Championship, helped the team reaching the semi-finals as his captain.
